Chapter 18, Part 4: The Attainment of Nothingness in the First Part
ÅšÄriputra!
The eye realm is empty of the nature of the eye realm.
Why is it so?
Because in the emptiness of the nature of the eye realm, the eye realm does not exist and cannot be found, and bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas also do not exist and cannot be found.
The eye realm is empty of the nature of the eye realm.
Why is it so?
Because in the emptiness of the nature of the eye realm, the eye realm does not exist and cannot be found, and bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas also do not exist and cannot be found.

The form realm, eye consciousness realm, and eye contact, as well as the feelings produced by eye contact, are empty of the nature of the form realm up to eye contact as the condition for the arising of feelings.
Why is it so?

The realm of form up to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings is empty, and the realm of form up to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings is non-existent and cannot be attained, therefore the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also non-existent and cannot be attained.

The realm of form, eye-consciousness, and eye-contact, and the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings are not the realm of form up to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings, because of the emptiness of the nature of the realm of form up to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings.
Why is it so?

Because in the emptiness of the nature of the realm of form up to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings, the realm of form up to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of various feelings is non-existent and cannot be attained, therefore the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The eye-realm is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, which is non-existent and cannot be attained, apart from the eye-realm the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be attained;

The form realm, eye consciousness realm, and eye contact, as well as the feelings produced by eye contact, are non-existent and cannot be attained. Apart from the form realm, eye consciousness realm, and eye contact, as well as the feelings produced by eye contact, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!
The ear realm is empty of the nature of the ear realm.
Why is it so?
Because in the emptiness of the nature of the ear realm, the ear realm does not exist and cannot be attained, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva also does not exist and cannot be attained.
The ear realm is empty of the nature of the ear realm.
Why is it so?
Because in the emptiness of the nature of the ear realm, the ear realm does not exist and cannot be attained, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva also does not exist and cannot be attained.
The sound realm, ear consciousness realm, and ear contact, as well as the feelings produced by ear contact, are empty of the nature of the sound realm up to the feelings produced by ear contact.
Why is it so?

In the emptiness of the nature of the sound element up to the ear contact as condition, the sound element up to the ear contact as condition do not exist and cannot be attained, and therefore a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva also does not exist and cannot be attained.
The sound element, ear consciousness element, and ear contact, and the various feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition are not the sound element up to the ear contact as a condition.
Why is it so?

In the emptiness of the nature of the sound element up to the ear contact as condition, the sound element up to the ear contact as condition do not exist and cannot be attained, and therefore a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva also does not exist and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be attained in the ear element, apart from the ear element;

The sound element, the ear consciousness element, and the ear contact, the sensory activity field of contact of the ear are the bodhisattva mahÄsattva, and the bodhisattva mahÄsattva is the sound element, the ear consciousness element, and the ear contact, the sensory activity field of contact of the ear.
ÅšÄriputra!
The nose element, the nose element is empty by nature.
Why is it so?
In the emptiness of the nature of the nose element, the nose element does not exist and cannot be found, and therefore the bodhisattva mahÄsattva also does not exist and cannot be found.
The nose element is not the nature of the nose element, and the nature of the nose element is empty.
Why is it so?
In the emptiness of the nature of the nose element, the nose element does not exist and cannot be found, and therefore the bodhisattva mahÄsattva also does not exist and cannot be found.

The smell element, the nose consciousness element, and the nose contact, the sensory activity field of contact of the nose, the smells, up to the nose contact, the sensory activity field of contact of the nose are empty.

In the emptiness of the nature of the nose, the nose consciousness, and nose contact, the nose, nose consciousness, and nose contact are non-existent and cannot be obtained, and therefore bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also non-existent and cannot be obtained.
The nature of the nose, nose consciousness, and nose contact is not the nose, nose consciousness, and nose contact.

In the emptiness of the nature of the nose, nose consciousness, and nose contact, the nose, nose consciousness, and nose contact are non-existent and cannot be obtained, and therefore bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also non-existent and cannot be obtained.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be obtained in the nose sense base, apart from the nose sense base;

the nose-consciousness element and the nose-contact and the mental activity associated with the nose-contact are non-existent and non-apprehensible, and apart from the nose-consciousness element and the nose-contact and the mental activity associated with the nose-contact, a bodhisattva is non-existent and non-apprehensible.
ÅšÄriputra!
The tongue element, the tongue element is empty of intrinsic nature.
Why is it so?
Because in the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of the tongue element, the tongue element is non-existent and non-apprehensible, therefore a bodhisattva is also non-existent and non-apprehensible.
The tongue element is not the intrinsic nature of the tongue element.

Because in the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of the tongue element, the tongue element is non-existent and non-apprehensible, therefore a bodhisattva is also non-existent and non-apprehensible.

Why is it so?
In the emptiness of the nature of the gustatory consciousness element and gustatory contact, the gustatory consciousness element and gustatory contact are non-apprehensible.

The gustatory consciousness element and gustatory contact are not empty because of the emptiness of the gustatory consciousness element and gustatory contact.ğŸ”½The gustatory consciousness element and gustatory contact are themselves emptiness.
Emptiness is itself the gustatory consciousness element and gustatory contact.
Therefore, ÅšÄriputra,
for this reason I say that in this deep perfection of wisdom the great vehicle is revealed.
The great vehicle is revealed in the emptiness of the nature of the gustatory consciousness element and gustatory contact.

The realm of taste, the tongue consciousness, and the tongue contact and the mental factors and states of mind that arise from the conditions of tongue contact, up to the bodhisattva mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be attained. Apart from the realm of taste, the tongue consciousness, and the tongue contact and the mental factors and states of mind that arise from the conditions of tongue contact, the bodhisattva mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be attained.

Because in the emptiness of the nature of the body element, the body element is non-existent and cannot be attained, the bodhisattva mahÄsattva is also non-existent and cannot be attained.

Because in the emptiness of the nature of not the body element, not the body element is non-existent and cannot be attained, the bodhisattva mahÄsattva is also non-existent and cannot be attained.

The touch element, the body consciousness element, and the body contact and the mental factors and states of mind that arise from the conditions of body contact, up to the touch element and the mental factors and states of mind that arise from the conditions of body contact are empty by nature.

In the emptiness of the nature of the sphere of touch up to bodily consciousness, the sphere of touch up to bodily consciousness do not exist and cannot be found. Therefore, bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas also do not exist and cannot be found.

The sphere of touch, bodily consciousness, and bodily contact and the feelings produced from bodily contact as a condition are not the sphere of touch up to bodily contact as a condition. The feelings produced from bodily contact as a condition are empty by nature.

In the emptiness of the nature of the sphere of touch up to bodily contact as a condition and the feelings produced from bodily contact as a condition, the sphere of touch up to bodily contact as a condition and the feelings produced from bodily contact as a condition do not exist and cannot be found. For this reason, I say:
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not exist in the sphere of the body and cannot be found, apart from the sphere of the body they do not exist and cannot be found.

The sphere of touch, the body consciousness, and the bodily contact and bodily contact as a condition for the production of sensations are all non-existent and cannot be apprehended. Apart from the sphere of touch, body consciousness, and bodily contact and bodily contact as a condition for the production of sensations, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

Because in the emptiness of the nature of the mind-sphere, the mind-sphere does not exist and cannot be apprehended, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva also does not exist and cannot be apprehended.
The mind-sphere is empty of the nature of the mind-sphere.
Why is it so?
Because in the emptiness of the nature of the mind-sphere, the mind-sphere does not exist and cannot be apprehended, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva also does not exist and cannot be apprehended.

The dharma-sphere, mind consciousness, and the mental contact and mental contact as a condition for the production of sensations are all empty of the nature of the dharma-sphere up to mental contact as a condition for the production of sensations.

In the emptiness of the nature of the dharma realm up to mental contact as a condition giving rise to the various feelings, the dharma realm up to mental contact as a condition giving rise to the various feelings have no existence and cannot be found, and therefore bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas also have no existence and cannot be found.

The dharma realm, mental consciousness realm, and mental contact, mental contact as a condition giving rise to the various feelings are not the emptiness of the dharma realm up to mental contact as a condition giving rise to the various feelings.

In the emptiness of the nature of the dharma realm up to mental contact as a condition giving rise to the various feelings, the dharma realm up to mental contact as a condition giving rise to the various feelings have no existence and cannot be found, and therefore bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas also have no existence and cannot be found.
ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be found in the eye-consciousness realm, and the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be found apart from the eye-consciousness realm.

the dharma realm, the mind consciousness realm, and the mental contact and mental contact as a condition that produces feelings, up to the bodhisattva mahÄsattva is non-existent and cannot be attained. The water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are empty by nature.

In the emptiness of the nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements do not exist and cannot be found, and therefore bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas also do not exist and cannot be found.

Formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress, formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are empty of the nature of formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress.

Because in the emptiness of the nature of volitional formations up to aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress, volitional formations up to aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are non-existent and cannot be obtained, and bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also non-existent and cannot be obtained.

that is to say, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are non-existent and cannot be attained, apart from the aggregates of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

Because in the emptiness of the nature of the eight liberations, the eight liberations do not exist and cannot be obtained, and bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas also do not exist and cannot be obtained.
The nature of the eight superior [meditative] states, the nine sequential [meditative] attainments, and the ten universal bases is empty.
Why is it so?

Because in the emptiness of the nature of the eight superior [meditative] states, the nine sequential [meditative] attainments, and the ten universal bases, the eight superior [meditative] states, the nine sequential [meditative] attainments, and the ten universal bases do not exist and cannot be obtained, and bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas also do not exist and cannot be obtained.
